503003349286137856.text: @wcronon thank you Bill! I am very glad you found it compelling!
503003349286137856.name: giorgialupi

502812995157000192.text: @iA We see it as a focus on a specific aspect, but I see your point, and you are probably right on the overall picture
502812995157000192.name: giorgialupi

502810703020175360.text: @iA Part of it was a choice of the editor also
502810703020175360.name: giorgialupi

502810666357772288.text: @iA (4/3 - always longer!!) then our topic was who is building now, with more space (maybe interactive?) we could visualize all of it !
502810666357772288.name: giorgialupi

502810394533302272.text: @iA 3/3 generally speaking: on this topic we could visualize many different things, many already wrote on disasters + decommissioning,
502810394533302272.name: giorgialupi

502810095659810816.text: @iA 2/3 we thought it might have been confusing to separate them (lots of status already) + it is the signal of the dismission in any case
502810095659810816.name: giorgialupi

502809956845117440.text: @iA 1/3 other debated one :) we grouped decommissioning and permanent shutdowns and treated them as events (not periods)
502809956845117440.name: giorgialupi

502805562854506496.text: @iA @PopSci @accuratstudio (3/2) ...but again, good point, I should write it on the post, thanks for bringing it up!
502805562854506496.name: giorgialupi

502805097148338176.text: @iA @PopSci @accuratstudio 2/2 but we didn't want to focus the pice on that: visualizing those cases would have eventually shifted the topic
502805097148338176.name: giorgialupi

502804709829525504.text: @iA @PopSci @accuratstudio 1/2 we discussed about it, good point; for Russia and Japan we wrote that above the countries,
502804709829525504.name: giorgialupi
